This is a game that is a true example of how a game can also be art. The visuals are beautiful and the mechanics behind it are immensely satisfying. The story that unfolds is good, but I won't speak more on it because spoilers. My only gripe with it is that on one or two occasions the movement felt a little clunky but besides that I have no complaints.

184932783.review:
Un juego que en VR gana muchísimo, y lo recomiendo bastante jugarlo de esta forma. Aunque es corto (unas 2 horas y media como máximo), ofrece una experiencia única. Probé el New Game+ esperando contenido adicional, pero no hay nada nuevo. La única diferencia es que tienes el escáner de puntos mejorado al máximo desde el inicio, lo cual no agrega variedad ni desafío.

Sobre el género:
Debo destacar que este juego está más enfocado en ser una walking simulation que en el terror. Si lo compras esperando sustos o una experiencia aterradora, podrías sentirte decepcionado. Sin embargo, si buscas algo único y diferente, este título no te defraudará.

La experiencia:
Pasas todo el tiempo en la oscuridad, sin linterna. En su lugar, tienes un escáner de puntos LIDAR para explorar el entorno, lo cual crea una atmósfera de claustrofobia, aislamiento y soledad muy bien lograda. Los efectos de sonido son excelentes, y los gráficos, aunque no son de última generación, encajan perfectamente con la ambientación. Este juego demuestra que el arte y el diseño creativo son mucho más importantes que los gráficos de alta fidelidad. Es un recordatorio de por qué muchos juegos retro de los 80, 90 y 2000 son atemporales.

Comparativa con otros títulos:
En este momento, hay pocos juegos que ofrezcan una experiencia similar basada en tecnología de escaneo láser. Conozco The Voidness y Sense of Darkness, pero en VR, Scanner Sombre es el rey. La sensación de estar atrapado y aislado está increíblemente bien conseguida.

Conclusión:
Aunque es corto, ofrece una experiencia memorable. Es una verdadera joya oculta en el catálogo de juegos de realidad virtual, y lo recomiendo muchísimo. Si buscas algo único, artístico y envolvente, este juego es para ti.

Great short game. While the core mechanic is really cool I felt it was underutalized and never really expanded upon. I think you could do some really cool puzzles with this which the game never really took advantage of (apart from the way it dealt with water. That is kinda the only time I felt the theme it set out with was elaborated upon.) The story also really isn't there. Again, the bones of something cool but it doesn't use its mechanics to further the impact of its story or really do anything with it. It feels like a walking sim with one cool mechanic, which is great, but walking sim relies on its story. Nothing was there textually to hook you and the story you do get is very much told and not shown. I feel as though the gameplay and writing were done entirely seperatly and that the story was an afterthought. A shame, especially given the potential it has as a variation of the walking sim genre.
Worth buying it though!!!!! Excellent way to spend a couple hours and you can really tell it was made with love. 
Yay indie games!!

183911097.review:
Oh boy I remember playing this at EGX Rezzed in London a few years back. Back then I thought that this was a cool concept game, but that's all it was a game 'concept', an idea, a tech demo.

Now having gotten round to playing it, well that's pretty much the final product, its a tech demo, an idea, a total concept, one that's looking for well, more of a game to go along with it.

Nothing really bad here TBH. Its a short experience, that seems like it will be a horror game and it tries a few scares from time to time. However as that wasn't the focus they’re few and far between. It's just you, a LiDar scanner as your only means of seeing and a cave system to find your way out of. Most deaths will be falling off a cliff, and that will be mostly due to first person platforming being a forever bad concept.

Overall it's an experiment of a game that got a release, and introversion even so still didn't quite know what to do with it.

Thumbs up as its worth checking out for the concept, but don't buy at full price. I'm glad I paid less than a pint for it.

2.5/5

Also note: The game comes with the prototype version of this game and a bomb defusing game that never went to full release.
